intro: Hieracium smithii, commonly known as Smith's hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces yellow flowers with a central disk. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
